sentence.Network_en: It would help to end illiteracy and disease, but it would also dislocate a traditional way of life.
sentence.Network_cn: 这将有助于消除文盲和疾病，但也会扰乱传统的生活方式。

sentence.Network_en: The strike at the financial nerve centre was designed to dislocate the economy.
sentence.Network_cn: 在金融活动中心地区的罢工是为了扰乱经济秩序。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: probably a back-formation from dislocation, but perhaps from medieval Latin dislocatus 'moved from a former position', from the verb dislocare

entry.tran: 使(骨头、关节)脱位;使脱臼
entry.def: If you dislocate a bone or joint in your body, or in someone else's body, it moves out of its proper position in relation to other bones, usually in an accident.

example.tran: 哈里森的一根手指脱臼了。

example.ex: He suffered a dislocated shoulder, cuts and bruises.
example.tran: 他肩膀脱臼了，身上还有伤口和挫伤。

entry.tran: 扰乱(制度、进程、生活方式等);使混乱;使运转不正常
entry.def: To dislocate something such as a system, process, or way of life means to disturb it greatly or prevent it from continuing as normal.

example.ex: It would help to end illiteracy and disease, but it would also dislocate a traditional way of life...
example.tran: 这将有助于消除文盲和疾病，但也会扰乱传统的生活方式。

example.ex: The strike at the financial nerve centre was designed to dislocate the economy.
example.tran: 在金融活动中心地区的罢工是为了扰乱经济秩序。

sentences.sentence: "the artificial hip joint luxated and had to be put back surgically"

means.word_mean: 2. put out of its usual place, position, or relationship;

sentences.en: The football player dislocated his shoulder.
sentences.cn: 那足球运动员的肩关节脱臼了。

means.word_mean: 使(交通, 事务等)混乱

sentences.en: Traffic was badly dislocated by the heavy fall of snow.
sentences.cn: 大雪使得交通非常混乱。
